definition: to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]

sentences.english: With desolation shall the earth be laid waste, and it shall be utterly spoiled: for the Lord hath spoken this word.
sentences.chinese: 大地必要完全荒廢，慘遭浩劫，因爲上主這樣定了。

sentences.english: Stock markets rallied as a form of relief from possible Armageddon.
sentences.chinese: 美國股市在避免了一場可能的末日浩劫之後出現反彈。

sentences.english: Experience a catastrophe after two people finally mutual defense, fall really love.
sentences.chinese: 閱歷過一場浩劫後的兩人終於互訴衷情，真心相愛了。

sentences.english: The tigers held sway for almost a century after the Doom of Valyria.
sentences.chinese: 在瓦雷利亞末日浩劫後虎黨的統治長達一世紀。

sentences.english: The town managed to escape the rigours of war.
sentences.chinese: 這個城鎮設法逃過了戰爭的浩劫。

sentences.english: And anti-Semitism in Europe culminated in an unprecedented holocaust.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲的反猶太主義最終發展成一場史無前例的浩劫。

sentences.english: Ten-year catastrophe, several times of ups and downs, were unable to reduce your true quality of a hero.
sentences.chinese: 十年浩劫，幾度沉浮，不減英雄本色。

sentences.english: Bottled water is an ecological catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 瓶裝水簡直是一場生態浩劫。

sentences.english: Dawn, street light, does it look like the catalyst?
sentences.chinese: 破曉，街燈，看起來像不像末日浩劫？

sentences.english: I intend the completion with karma for war and torture within the human dream.
sentences.chinese: 我希望人類之夢中戰爭與浩劫業力的完結。

sentences.english: A second series of destruction followed when eight allied armies put down the Boxer Movement in 1900.
sentences.chinese: 第二次浩劫是1900年的八國聯軍鎮壓義和團運動。

sentences.english: There's still a lot more wasteland out there that has yet to be explored.
sentences.chinese: 浩劫後的世界裏，有許多荒野祕境等你來探索。

definition: people are in a terrible situation (idiom)
to extinguish/to become extinct/to die out
this life/to lose face/to be disgraced
